Comments: This cover sheet has been added by SIAM to identify the winning team after judging was completed. Any identifying information other than team \# on an M3 Challenge submission is a rules violation.

Assumption: We can discount the segment of the population that suffers from disorders which stunt or accelerate the normal rate of growth.
Rate of growth in children is assumed to follow average growth charts provided by the World Health Organization (WHO).
Larger and smaller rates of growth occur with similar frequency.
Age in children does not change energy requirements for tissue growth. Therefore, average energy expenditure for growth is constant relative to age.
Growth rate at a certain age can be summarized on a yearly basis.
Growth rate follows height trends seen in the World Health Organization height-to-age charts.
The calories burned by a set amount of lean body mass is the same between genders. Thus, the difference between genders is accounted for by the difference in average body fat.
A mean value for average body fat percentage is constant and unaffected by age.
Model: BMR\_f(1) \= GR\_f(1) \* E / h \= 191 / h (Female Age Group 1)
BMR\_f(2) \= GR\_f(2) \* E / h (Female Age Group 2)
BMR\_m(1) \= GR\_m(1) \* E / h \= 178 / h (Male Age Group 1)
BMR\_m(2) \= GR\_m(2) \* E / h (Male Age Group 2)
BMR \= BMR\_f(n) or m(n) \+ BMR\_height \+ BMR\_weight \+ BMR\_LBM
Results: Average caloric intake for males and females, ages 10-19
More high-schoolers are sleep deprived than not.
None of the students in high school can be supported with the 750-850-calorie meal plan proposed by the HHFKA.

Assumption: Schools will comply with the federal mandate to adopt the new lunch plans.
Students all over the country are, on average, only marginally different; there are no major cultural or dietary variations.
The unit cost of each dish is fixed per location and per portion size.
Model: Constraints based on USDA guidelines for food groups and sodium.
Budget constraint of $7.00 per week per student.
Objective function: maximize the amount of calories distributed.
Results: Generated weekly food plans for K-5 and 9-12 grade ranges with $6 and $7 budgets.
The largest deficit was 832 calories for the high school $6-per-week-per-student budget.
Sensitivity Analysis: The two variables with the greatest constraining factors on the model are the USDA minimum grains and maximum sodium requirements.
